comments:

The Javadoc in IPresentablePart for methods like getTitle(), getTitleToolTip
(), etc. should indicate if null is a valid return value.
Nick, please forward to whoever is reviewing this.

Stefan, I'm assigning editor presentation bugs to you for now.
I talked to MvM and he said we'd have to do some load balancing since you have a
full plate.

WorkbenchPart.getTitleToolTip() has always returned null as the default,
contrary to spec.  We can't back out of this now, so we need to handle it.  The
spec should be updated to allow null.  Likewise for setTitleToolTip.

It's all good, Nick. This one is easy.

IPresentablePart does not allow null for any of these methods (I'll add JavaDoc
to that effect). Even if WorkbenchPart is allowed to return null, the
IPresentablePart implementation must convert that into an empty string.

- Entered bug 59381 for comment 4
- The NPE has been fixed in head
- Added JavaDoc to IPresentablePart as per comment 1
- Added null checks to IWorkbenchPart method calls, to ensure that any further
bugs in WorkbenchPart don't get inherited by IPresentablePart.
- Fixed remaining issues in bug 55177

FYI, I tested this fix by hardcoding the return value of WorkbenchPartReference
to be null, and checking for NPEs in my inner workspace.
